alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Clay; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 12:29AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Pocahontas, Nicholas, southern Braxton, Webster, eastern Clay and Fayette Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1229 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Summersville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Fayetteville, Richwood, Rainelle, Sutton, Babcock State Park, Webster Springs, Oak Hill, Mount Hope, Ansted, Gassaway, Addison (Webster Springs), Camden-On-gauley, Hawks Nest State Park, Birch River, Craigsville, Camden On Gauley, Bradley, Piney View and Harrison. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 46 and 62. Route 19 between mile markers 4 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Clay; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster
